conflictDescription: User Story A wants the system to allow inviting friends to play games and chat freely, while User Story B forbids any communication unless the user initiates it, to avoid unwanted messages. These are opposite expectations about communication starting automatically or by invitation.
userStoryASummary: As an older adult, I want to invite friends to play challenging games and chat freely, so I can have fun and feel connected.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to control all communication with family and friends myself to avoid almost all unwanted messages and keep it formal.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to include user control over communication initiation and permission to invite friends, balancing free interaction and avoiding unwanted messages.
newUserStoryASummary: As an older adult, I want to invite friends to play games and chat, with control over who can join, so I can have fun and stay connected safely.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to control all communication initiation to avoid unwanted messages, while allowing invitations from trusted friends.

conflictDescription: User Story A wants to start challenging games and chat freely, while User Story B wants to forbid challenging games and only do simple, slow memory activities. These are opposite expectations for the same type of games.
userStoryASummary: As an older adult, I want to invite friends to play challenging games and chat freely, so I can have fun and feel connected.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to avoid all challenging games and only do very simple and slow memory activities to not feel stressed or overwhelmed.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story B is updated to allow simple memory activities with optional low-stress social interaction, while User Story A remains to enable challenging games and chat freely. This reduces direct conflict by emphasizing stress avoidance in B and social engagement in A.
newUserStoryASummary: As an older adult, I want to invite friends to play challenging games and chat freely, so I can have fun and feel connected.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to do simple and slow memory activities with gentle social interaction, so I do not feel stressed or overwhelmed.

conflictDescription: User Story A wants to allow inviting friends to play games and chat freely (digital contact), while User Story B forbids digital contact and wants social visits only in person. These are opposite instructions about digital social interaction.
userStoryASummary: As an older adult, I want to invite friends to play challenging games and chat freely, so I can have fun and feel connected.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to arrange social visits only in person to avoid digital contact and keep full control.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to allow digital and in-person social interactions selectively, based on user preference, removing the direct conflict.
newUserStoryASummary: As an older adult, I want to invite friends to play games and chat digitally, so I can have fun and feel connected when I choose.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to arrange social visits in person and limit digital contact, so I feel safe and keep control when preferred.

conflictDescription: User Story A wants the system to allow spontaneous chats with strangers anytime, but User Story B forbids any communication unless the user initiates it, to avoid unwanted messages. These are opposite instructions for handling communication.
userStoryASummary: As an older person, I want to chat freely with strangers anytime on ALFRED to feel less lonely and more connected.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to control all communication with family and friends myself to avoid almost all unwanted messages and keep it formal.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story A is updated to allow chatting only with user consent or initiation to avoid unwanted messages, while User Story B remains to keep user control over communication.
newUserStoryASummary: As an older person, I want to chat with others only when I choose, so I can feel connected without unwanted messages.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to control all communication with family and friends myself to avoid almost all unwanted messages and keep it formal.

conflictDescription: User Story A wants to allow chatting freely with strangers anytime, but User Story B wants to arrange social visits only in person and avoid digital contact. These are opposite instructions about using digital communication for social interaction.
userStoryASummary: As an older person, I want to chat freely with strangers anytime on ALFRED to feel less lonely and more connected.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to arrange social visits only in person to avoid digital contact and keep full control.
resolutionDescription: We update both user stories to separate digital chatting from in-person social visits, so both can coexist without contradiction.
newUserStoryASummary: As an older person, I want to chat freely with known friends digitally to feel less lonely and connected.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to arrange social visits only in person to keep full control and avoid strangers.

conflictDescription: User Story A expects ALFRED to provide information about who is online to chat digitally, while User Story B forbids digital contact by allowing only in-person social visits. These are opposite expectations for the same social interaction feature.
userStoryASummary: As an older person, I want to ask ALFRED who is online to chat now so I can talk freely with friends or new people anytime.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to arrange social visits only in person to avoid digital contact and keep full control.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story A is updated to allow digital chat only when the user chooses or in safe, controlled settings, respecting User Story B's preference for in-person visits. This keeps User Story B unchanged as a strict preference for in-person social visits.
newUserStoryASummary: As an older person, I want to ask ALFRED who is online to chat when I choose, so I can connect safely and comfortably.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to arrange social visits only in person to avoid digital contact and keep full control.

conflictDescription: User Story A wants to start video calls freely with family, but User Story B forbids communication unless the user fully controls it to avoid unwanted messages. These are opposite expectations about starting communication.
userStoryASummary: As an older person, I want to start a video call with my niece using ALFRED, so that I can chat casually without formal language and stay connected easily.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to control all communication with family and friends myself to avoid almost all unwanted messages and keep it formal.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to balance easy video calls and user control to avoid unwanted messages by adding user consent and formal control options.
newUserStoryASummary: As an older person, I want to start video calls with family easily, so that I can chat casually while keeping control over who can call me.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to control all communications with family and friends, so that I avoid unwanted messages but still allow approved calls.

conflictDescription: User Story A wants to start video calls while User Story B wants to arrange social visits only in person, avoiding digital contact. These are opposite expectations about using digital communication for social interaction.
userStoryASummary: As an older person, I want to start a video call with my niece using ALFRED, so that I can chat casually without formal language and stay connected easily.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to arrange social visits only in person to avoid digital contact and keep full control.
resolutionDescription: Allow both video calls and in-person visits by updating user stories to include user preference for either digital or physical social interaction, depending on comfort and control.
newUserStoryASummary: As an older person, I want to start a video call with my niece using ALFRED, so that I can stay connected easily when I prefer digital contact.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to arrange social visits in person using ALFRED, so that I can keep full control and avoid digital contact when I prefer.

conflictDescription: User Story A expects the system to allow playing hard brain games during chats, which implies ongoing interaction initiated by the system or others. User Story B forbids all communication that is not initiated by the user, aiming to avoid unwanted messages, which conflicts with the interactive nature of games during chats.
userStoryASummary: As an older adult, I want to play hard brain games during chats to stay active and enjoy time with friends.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to control all communication with family and friends myself to avoid almost all unwanted messages and keep it formal.
resolutionDescription: Both stories are updated to allow playing brain games during user-initiated chats only, maintaining user control while enabling interactive activities.
newUserStoryASummary: As an older adult, I want to play hard brain games during chats I start to stay active and enjoy time with friends.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to control all communication with family and friends and avoid unwanted messages, allowing only chats I initiate.

conflictDescription: User Story A wants to play hard brain games during chats, but User Story B forbids challenging games and wants only simple and slow memory activities. These are opposite expectations about the type of games allowed at the same event.
userStoryASummary: As an older adult, I want to play hard brain games during chats to stay active and enjoy time with friends.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to avoid all challenging games and only do very simple and slow memory activities to not feel stressed or overwhelmed.
resolutionDescription: We adjust both stories to allow a range of brain games from simple to challenging, so users can choose what fits their comfort and engagement levels.
newUserStoryASummary: As an older adult, I want to play brain games during chats with different difficulty levels, so I can stay active and enjoy time with friends.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to play simple and slow memory games during chats, so I do not feel stressed or overwhelmed.

conflictDescription: User Story A wants to start hard exercise games, while User Story B forbids challenging games and only wants simple, slow activities. These are opposite expectations about the same activity type.
userStoryASummary: As an older person, I want to join hard exercise games with ALFRED, so I can stay motivated and challenge myself.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to avoid all challenging games and only do very simple and slow memory activities to not feel stressed or overwhelmed.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story B is updated to allow some mild exercise games to reduce stress, while User Story A remains to allow hard exercise games for motivation.
newUserStoryASummary: As an older person, I want to join hard exercise games with ALFRED, so I can stay motivated and challenge myself.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to do mild and slow memory activities with ALFRED, so I do not feel stressed or overwhelmed.

conflictDescription: User Story A wants the system to encourage learning and new challenges with technology, while User Story B wants to avoid all challenging games and only use very simple and slow activities. These are opposite expectations on the system's behavior regarding game difficulty and challenge.
userStoryASummary: As an older person, I want my caregiver to encourage my interest in technology so I can learn more and enjoy new challenges.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to avoid all challenging games and only do very simple and slow memory activities to not feel stressed or overwhelmed.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to allow a personalized approach where the system offers learning and challenges while respecting user preference for simpler activities when needed.
newUserStoryASummary: As an older adult, I want to explore new technology challenges with support, so I can learn and grow at my own pace.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to do simple and slow memory activities, but I can try more challenging games when I feel ready.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires the system to always send health updates automatically, while User Story B forbids showing vital signs unless the user asks, creating opposite system behaviors for the same event of health data availability.
userStoryASummary: As an older adult, I want to receive all health updates from my wearable device all the time, so I can stay fully informed and manage my health actively.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to see my vital signs only when I ask, so I control my privacy and avoid all unwanted alerts.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: Update User Story A to send important health updates automatically but allow the user to control detailed vital signs visibility, keeping User Story B unchanged to respect user privacy control.
newUserStoryASummary: As an older adult, I want to receive important health updates automatically, so I stay informed but keep control over detailed vital signs.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to see my vital signs only when I ask, so I control my privacy and avoid all unwanted alerts.
